product.title: SaaS / Ops Dashboard
bullets: Prioritize information density with progressive disclosure.
Keep a fixed alert surface and a collapsible detail rail.
Use status colors sparingly: success/warning/critical only.

product.title: Logistics / Fleet Control
bullets: Map-first layout: overlays must never block pan/zoom/tap.
Use bottom-sheet controls on mobile instead of side rails.
Expose route/style toggles with large touch targets.

product.title: Healthcare / MedTech
bullets: Favor calm visual rhythm with high readability.
Use conservative motion and explicit validation states.
Add strong contrast and assistive labeling patterns.

style.title: Glassmorphism
bullets: Use higher opacity on light mode (>=80%) for readability.
Avoid stacking too many translucent layers over map/data.
Pair with strong border contrast and subtle shadowing.

style.title: Minimalism
bullets: Limit visual vocabulary: one accent, one neutral ramp.
Use spacing and typography for hierarchy before color.
Keep component states obvious without ornamental motion.

typography.title: Professional Pairing
bullets: Headings: Instrument Serif (italic accents only).
Body/UI: Instrument Sans with 14-16px baseline.
Data: JetBrains Mono for telemetry values only.

typography.title: Elegant Pairing
bullets: Headings: high-contrast serif; body: geometric sans.
Increase line-height and reduce uppercase tracking overload.
Reserve italics for short accents, not full paragraphs.

color.title: Ops Dark Palette
bullets: Primary: #0D0D0F, Surface: #17171A, Border: #2A2A2F.
Text high: #E5E7EB, text muted: #8A8A92.
States: success #0F9960, warning #FFB000, critical #FF4D4F.

color.title: Fintech Clean Palette
bullets: Use slate base with restrained blue accent.
Keep CTA color distinct from warning/critical states.
Never rely on color alone for state communication.

landing.title: Hero-Centric Structure
bullets: Flow: Hero -> social proof -> feature value -> CTA.
Show product evidence in first viewport.
Use one primary CTA phrase consistently.

landing.title: Social-Proof Heavy Structure
bullets: Place trust marks and case studies above pricing.
Quantify outcomes with specific metrics.
Keep testimonial cards short and skimmable.

chart.title: Trend / Time Series
bullets: Use line/area charts for rate-over-time signals.
Include baseline, threshold, and incident markers.
Avoid more than 4 concurrent lines on mobile.

chart.title: Comparison
bullets: Use horizontal bars for long category labels.
Sort values descending for fast scan.
Highlight only one focal series.

ux.title: Responsive + Touch
bullets: No fixed overlays should block primary canvas interactions on mobile.
Target minimum touch area of 44x44px.
Prefer bottom sheet + bottom nav over stacked side panels.

ux.title: Z-index + Layering
bullets: Define a single layering scale and stick to it.
Use pointer-events-none on decorative layers only.
Audit hidden panels for offscreen hitbox interception.

ux.title: Accessibility
bullets: Maintain visible focus rings for keyboard users.
Hit 4.5:1 contrast for body text and controls.
Use reduced-motion media query for nonessential animation.

prompt.title: CSS Prompt Keywords
bullets: Use terms like: high-contrast, touch-safe spacing, layered gradient backdrop.
Specify mobile-first with non-blocking overlays.
State exact constraints for accessibility and interaction.

html-tailwind.title: Tailwind Responsive Foundation
bullets: Build mobile-first, then enhance via sm/md/lg breakpoints.
Use explicit pointer-events utility classes for overlay layers.
Prefer CSS vars for shared color tokens.

react.title: React UI State Boundaries
bullets: Keep viewport/layout state close to app shell and pass explicit props.
Avoid duplicate media-query logic across unrelated components.
Use memoization only where render profiling shows benefit.

nextjs.title: Next.js UI Delivery
bullets: Use server components for data-heavy static UI sections.
Split interactive panels into client components.
Enforce responsive image sizing and priority only above fold.

vue.title: Vue Composition UI Patterns
bullets: Group layout state in composables to reduce prop drilling.
Keep interactive overlays isolated with explicit emits.
Use computed for derived panel datasets.

svelte.title: Svelte Reactive Layouts
bullets: Use stores for global layout mode and panel visibility.
Keep transitions lightweight on mobile.
Guard browser-only APIs in onMount.

swiftui.title: SwiftUI Structure
bullets: Model overlays as sheets for mobile ergonomics.
Use size classes and safe-area insets explicitly.
Avoid layered ZStack blockers over map gestures.

react-native.title: React Native Patterns
bullets: Use bottom tabs for main nav and modal sheets for tools.
Respect hitSlop and minimum touch targets.
Keep map gestures independent from overlay responders.

flutter.title: Flutter Layout Practices
bullets: Use LayoutBuilder/MediaQuery for breakpoint-safe UIs.
Keep overlays in controlled stacks with clear hit testing.
Use const widgets and selective rebuilds for smoothness.

shadcn.title: shadcn/ui Patterns
bullets: Use Radix primitives for dialogs, sheets, and menus.
Do not customize away focus outlines.
Prefer tokenized classnames for theme consistency.
